meanings.definition: To incorrectly name or identify someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She kept miscalling her friend by the wrong name.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was miscalling the students during roll call.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was miscalling the dog, thinking it was a cat.
meanings.sent4: The faulty GPS was miscalling the streets, leading us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: The detective's habit of miscalling suspects made solving the case difficult.

meanings.definition: A mistake in naming or identifying someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The miscalling of the patient's name caused confusion at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent2: The miscalling of the winner's name at the award ceremony was embarrassing.
meanings.sent3: The miscalling of the recipe ingredient made the dish taste strange.
meanings.sent4: The miscalling of the rare bird species led to a mix-up in the wildlife database.
meanings.sent5: The miscalling of historical events in the textbook confused the students.
